revised_title: Prolonged Exposure to Liquid Air Temperature and Its Effects on Micro-Organisms and Photogenic Bacteria
tldr: This study investigates the effects of prolonged exposure to liquid air temperature on micro-organisms and photogenic bacteria. The results show that a six-month exposure to -190°C has no appreciable effect on the vitality of micro-organisms, and mechanical trituration at the temperature of liquid air abolishes the luminosity of photogenic bacteria, suggesting that bioluminescence is a function of the living cell.
